description:
Two papers accepted at ICCV 2025. Congratulations to
  • Han-Hung and Qinghong for their work on NuiScene: Exploring Efficient Generation of Unbounded Outdoor Scenes.
  • Qirui and Denys for their work on Diorama: Unleashing Zero-shot Single-view 3D Scene Modeling.

Talks and workshops at CVPR 2025.
  • June 11th - Talk at Workshop on 3D Scene Understanding for Vision, Graphics, and Robotics
  • June 11th - Talk at Workshop on 3D Vision Language Models (VLMs) for Robotic Manipulation
  • June 12th - Talk at Workshop on Bridging Language, Vision and Action in 3D Environments
  • June 12th - Talk at Workshop on Compositional 3D Vision
  • June 12th - Co-organizing the Embodied-AI workshop
Invited talk at CRV 2025.
Congratulations to Austin and ZeMing on the acceptance of their paper ViGiL3D: A Linguistically Diverse Dataset for 3D Visual Grounding to ACL 2025.
Congratulations to Xingguang, Han-Hung, and Ziyu for receiving the best paper award at 3DV for their work on An Object is Worth 64x64 Pixels: Generating 3D Object via Image Diffusion!

Three papers accepted at ICLR 2025. Congratulations to
  • Han-Hung and Yiming for their work on Duoduo CLIP: Efficient 3D Understanding with Multi-View Images.
  • ZeMing, Austin, and Xiaoliang for their work on CLIBD: Bridging Vision and Genomics for Biodiversity Monitoring at Scale.
  • Jiayi and Denys for their work on SINGAPO: Single Image Controlled Generation of Articulated Parts in Objects.
We are excited that NeurIPS will be Vancouver and will be running a series of exciting talks on the mornings of Dec 11-13. See event page for details.

Two papers accepted at 3DV 2025. Congratulations to
  • Xingguang, Han-Hung, and Ziyu for their work on An Object is Worth 64x64 Pixels: Generating 3D Object via Image Diffusion.
  • Ivan, Derek, and Austin for their work on SceneMotifCoder: Example-driven Visual Program Learning for Generating 3D Object Arrangements.
Talk (remote) at Workshop on AI Meets Autonomy: Vision, Language, and Autonomous Systems at IROS 2024
BIOSCAN-5M: A Multimodal Dataset for Insect Biodiversity accepted at NeurIPS datasets and benchmarks 2024.
Talk (remote) at Workshop on Advances in Language and Vision Research (ALVR) at ACL 2024
Congratulations to Qirui and Sonia on the acceptance of their paper R3DS: Reality-linked 3D Scenes for Panoramic Scene Understanding at ECCV 2024.
Talk at CIFAR DLRLSS on language and 3D

Workshops at CVPR 2024.
  • June 17th - AI for 3D Generation
  • June 17th pm - Workshop on Multimodalities for 3D Scenes
  • June 18th - Embodied AI workshop
Papers at workhops and main conference
  • June 18th - R3DS: Reality-linked 3D Scenes for Panoramic Scene Understanding at workshop on Synthetic Data for Computer Vision
  • June 18th - BIOSCAN-CLIP: Bridging Vision and Genomics for Biodiversity Monitoring at Scale at workshop on Fine-Grained Visual Categorization
  • June 20th - Habitat Synthetic Scenes Dataset (HSSD-200): An Analysis of 3D Scene Scale and Realism Tradeoffs for ObjectGoal Navigation
I have received tenure!
I'm presenting a talk on Text to 3D at Upper Bound in Edmonton.
Han-Hung presented his state-of-the-art report (STAR) on Text to 3D Shape Generation at Eurographics 2024.
Qirui and Xiaohao presented their papers at 3DV 2024 on Generalizing Single-View 3D Shape Retrieval to Occlusions and Unseen Objects and OPDMulti: Openable Part Detection for Multiple Objects.
Congratulations to Yiming Zhang for defending his MSc thesis!

Two papers accepted at WACV 2024. Congratulations to
  • Sonia and Tommaso for their work on MOPA: Modular Object Navigation with PointGoal Agents.
  • Yue, Han-Hung and Yiming for their work on TriCoLo: Trimodal Contrastive Loss for Text to Shape Retrieval.

Two papers accepted at 3DV 2024. Congratulations to
  • Xiaohao and Shawn for their work on OPDMulti: Openable Part Detection for Multiple Objects.
  • Qirui for his work on Generalizing Single-View 3D Shape Retrieval to Occlusions and Unseen Objects.

Workshops at ICCV 2023.
  • Oct 2nd - Workshop on 3D Vision and Modeling Challenges in eCommerce
  • Oct 2nd - Workshop on closing the loop between vision and language (CLVL)
  • Oct 3rd pm - Workshop on Language for 3D Scenes (L3DS)
I'm happy to be a recipient of the Sony Research Award for 2022.
Congratulations to ZeMing (together with Zahra and Nick from U. of Waterloo) on the acceptance of their work BIOSCAN-1M Insect dataset at NeurIPS datasets and benchmarks 2023.

Three papers accepted at ICCV 2023. Congratulations to
  • Yiming and ZeMing for their work on Multi3DRefer, a extension of 3D visual grounding to multiple objects
  • Dave for his work on UniT3D, a unified transformer model for 3D visual grounding and captioning
  • Enrico and Tommaso for their work on proximity-aware tasks for social navigation
Lecture on natural language processing at Invent the Future: AI Scholars Program at Simon Fraser University
Talk on Connecting 3D and Language at Seoul National University.
Talk on Connecting 3D and Language at University of Padova.
Tutorial on Language and 3D at SGP 2023.

Workshops and talks at CVPR 2023.
  • June 18th - Talk at workshop on 3D vision and robotics
  • June 18th - Talk at workshop on compositional 3D vision
  • June 19th - Talk at WiCV workshop
  • June 19th - Talk at Open-Domain Reasoning Under Multi-Modal Settings workshop
  • June 19th - ScanNet Indoor Scene Understanding Challenge
  • June 19th - Multi-Object Navigation Challenge at the Embodied-AI workshop
Congratulations to Shawn Jiang for defending his MSc thesis!
Talk on Connecting 3D and Language at 3DL group seminar at University of Chicago
Keynote at WACV 2023 workshop on Photorealistic Image and Environment Synthesis for Computer Vision (PIES-CV).
Invited talk at CoRL 2022 workshop on Learning, Perception, and Abstraction for Long-Horizon Planning.
Habitat Rearrangement Competition (Dec 8th) at NeurIPS 2022.

Workshops at ECCV 2022.
  • Oct 23rd - Workshop on Language for 3D Scenes
  • Oct 23rd - Workshop on Learning to Generate 3D Shapes and Scenes
One paper accepted at NeurIPS 2022.  Congratulations to Yongsen, Yiming, and Shawn for their work on MultiScan.
One paper accepted at 3DV 2022. Congratulations to Sanjay, Xiaohao, and Shawn for their work on understanding articulated 3D human-object interactions.

Two papers accepted at ECCV 2022. Congratulations to
  • Dave and Qirui for their work on D3Net, a speaker-listener model for 3D visual grounding and captioning
  • Shawn and Yongsen for their work on OPDet for openable part detection from single-view images
Lecture on natural language processing at Invent the Future: AI Scholars Program at Simon Fraser University

Workshops and Tutorials at CVPR 2022.
  • June 19th - ScanNet Indoor Scene Understanding Challenge
  • June 19th - Multi-Object Navigation Challenge at the Embodied-AI workshop
  • June 20th - Tutorial: Building and Working in Environments for Embodied AI
3DVQA work by Yasaman and Leon will be presented at CRV 2022.
Congratulations to Ali Gholami and Yue Ruan for defending their MSc thesis!

I'm excited to be part of BIOSCAN, a large, world-wide collaboration to identify and categorize the species of the world, and understand how they interact. I'm looking for a postdoc to use the latest advances in machine learning to develop algorithms to contribute to this project.
We are hosting the Multi-Object Navigation challenge, as part of the embodied AI workshop at CVPR 2022.
I'm happy to be hosting Dave Zhenyu Chen and Tommaso Campari as visiting students this term at SFU.
Habitat 2.0 to be presented at NeurIPS 2021 as a spotlight, and HM3D accepted to NeurIPS 2021 datasets and benchmarks.
Short paper on using language-aligned waypoints for supervising VLN-CE accepted to EMNLP 2021. Congratulations to Sonia, Shivansh, Saim, and Unnat!
Congratulations to Leon Kochiev for defending his MSc thesis!
Paper studying communication mechanisms between embodied AI agents for navigation accepted at ICCV 2021. Great job by Shivansh, Saim and Unnat!
Lecture on natural language processing at Invent the Future: AI Scholars Program at Simon Fraser University
SGP (Symposium for Geometry Processing) happening virtually!
Roominoes accepted to SGP 2021. Congratulations to Kai!

Challenges and Workshops at CVPR 2021.
  • June 19th - 3D Vision and Robotics
  • June 20th - ScanNet Indoor Scene Understanding Challenge
  • June 20th - Multi-Object Navigation Challenge at the Embodied-AI workshop
  • June 25th - Learning to Generate 3D Shapes and Scenes
  • June 25th - Language for 3D Scenes
Three papers accepted at CVPR 2021.  Great job by Madhawa, Qirui, Jiaqi, Lewis, Dave, and Ali!
I'm co-chairing SGP (Symposium for Geometry Processing) with Alec Jacobson.
Invited talk at Emerging Technologies: BC's AI Showcase
Whitepaper on Rearrangement: A Challenge for Embodied AI
Papers accepted at UIST 2020, 3DV 2020, and NeurIPS 2020
Lecture on natural language processing at Invent the Future: AI Scholars Program at Simon Fraser University
Invited talk at the Workshop on Advances in Language and Vision Research (ALVR) at ACL 2020
ScanNet received the Symposium on Geometry Processing (SGP) dataset award.
Paper on localizing objects based on natural language descriptions in 3D scans (ScanRefer) is accepted at ECCV 2020.

I'm co-organizing three workshops at CVPR 2020
  • June 14th - Learning 3D Generative Models (CVPR daily)
  • June 14-15th - Embodied-AI Workshop
  • June 19th - ScanNet Indoor Scene Understanding Challenge (CVPR daily)
Paper on simulation platform with articulated parts (SAPIEN) is accepted at CVPR 2020.
I'm teaching CMPT 825 Natural language Processing this spring
I started as assistant professor at Simon Fraser University
Lecture on deep learning for images at the DLRL Summer School at University of Alberta
Lecture on natural language processing at Invent the Future: AI Scholors Program at Simon Fraser University
Invited talk at the 360 Indoor Scene Understanding and Modeling (SUMO) workshop at CVPR
I'm visiting Facebook AI Research this summer
PartNet prerelease v0 is now available!
Two upcoming workshops at CVPR 2019: 3D Scene Generation workshop and Scannet Indoor Scene Understanding workshop
Three papers accepted at CVPR 2019
I'm honored to be named to the first cohort of CIFAR AI Chairs.
Visual Learning and Embodied Agents in Simulation Environments at ECCV 2018.
Visiting Matthias Niessner at TUM.
ShapeNet received the Symposium on Geometry Processing (SGP) dataset award.
Invited talk at RSS 2018 workshop on New Benchmarks, Metrics, and Competitions for Robotic Learning.
ScanNet v2 release and ScanNet Benchmark challenge announced.
I joined Eloquent Labs.
Co-organizing ECCV 2018 workshop on Visual Learning and Embodied Agents in Simulation Environments.
I was awarded the TUM-IAS Hans Fischer Fellowship.
